meanings.definition: A flow of fluid in the opposite direction to the main flow.
meanings.sent1: The counterflow of the river made it difficult for the boat to move forward.
meanings.sent2: The counterflow of traffic on the highway caused a delay in reaching our destination.
meanings.sent3: The counterflow of the fountain water created a mesmerizing dance in the air.
meanings.sent4: The counterflow of ideas in the meeting led to a clash of opinions.
meanings.sent5: The counterflow of emotions in her heart made it hard to make a decision.

meanings.definition: To flow in the opposite direction to something else.
meanings.sent1: She had to counterflow against the strong current to reach the other side of the river.
meanings.sent2: The air in the room seemed to counterflow whenever someone opened a window.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to counterflow in the game of tag, confusing everyone.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts counterflowed against the traditional beliefs of his family.
meanings.sent5: The rebellious spirit in her always counterflowed against authority.
